newsitem.title: UK: Med oil products mixed - gas oil firm on Italy buy.
newsitem.headline: Med oil products mixed - gas oil firm on Italy buy.

text.p: Mediterranean oil products were mixed on Wednesday, traders said.
Gasoline slipped $1 a tonne but naphtha was steady supported by firmer Asian swaps.
Dealers said Nigeria demand was continuing to support current levels on gasoline and talk for naphtha was $2 a tonne above the formula for north African grades.
Gas oil prices were firmer with supportive buying into Italy and Spain and recent demand for product to fill tenders into Turkey and Greece leaving supplies generally tighter.
Traders said diesel's narrow differential to 0.2 sulphur oil was also adding to the tightness.
"Refiners are reluctant to run EN590 while the differential to 0.2 sulphur material is so small" one trader said.
They said there was good buying for prompt diesel cargoes with around three buyers chasing one cargo. Demand for second half July was also seen staying strong.

0.2 sulphur supplies were also tight following good demand from the east Med. A Russian cargo was reported traded at benchmark quotes fob high +$4 a tonne fob Italy with diesel actively bid at the same level.
High sulphur fuel oil was largely unchanged with the market said to be stable on low avails with no new incoming Russian material.
"The Black Sea is completely dry that's why the market rose recently," one trader said.
"It's difficult to put figures in the absence of deals but I think the market for high sulphur is $88/$89 cif," a second trader said.
"Levels are much more stable in the Med than in northern Europe both for cracked and straight-run because of the low supplies," he added.
One percent was quiet but a large cargo, up to 70,000 tonnes, bought by a trader in NWE at a floating price was heard headed to the Mediterranean.
